results.title: Stage door [DVD]
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Pandro S. Berman and Gregory La Cava
results.brief_description: This witty, sparkling comedy about the trials of numerous aspiring stage actresses, features an array of fine performances from up and coming stars of the 30s. Katherine Hepburn plays Terry Randall, a naive heiress, committed to her craft who anticipates work materialising out of sheer professionalism and perseverance. Boarding at a theatrical residence, where an atmosphere of gay penury prevails, Terry’s housemates attempt to demystify her idealism with their realistic take on an actress’ life - the casting couch, sugar daddies, endless futile auditions and a dearth of work for the talented and talent-less alike. Sharing a room with Terry is Jean (Ginger Rogers) a sassy tap dancer, accustomed to clashing with her fellow thespians, who forms a truce with the secretly wealthy Terry. With the show business setting and putting-on-a-show structure of many classic Hollywood musicals, “Stage door” also contains dramatic turns that relay the dark side and perils of the business. Cast includes: Adolphe Menjou, Lucille Ball, Eve Arden, Ann Miller, Constance Collier. Adapted from the Edna Ferber and George S. Kaufman stage hit.

results.title: Stadium
results.brief_description:
Short experimental film capturing the atmosphere of Melbourne’s iconic MCG stadium at night whilst hosting a soccer match during the 2000 Sydney Olympics.
No commentary, using sound effects only.

results.title: Stachka = Strike (Musical soundtrack)
results.brief_description:
Eisenstein conceived his first film not as the portrayal of an actual historical event but as a generalised picture of a strike without individual heroes; the mass is a collective hero represented by types rather than characters.of poster-like sketches containing Eisenstein’s first experiments with montage both for direct emotional impact (collision) and for the presentation of abstract ideas (metaphor). A constructivist approach is evident in the way machinery is represented not as dominating the workers but as being enlisted by them in the struggle. Also available on VHS, LD and 16mm.

Credits: Director, Sergei Eisenstein ; photographer, E. Tisse, Vassili Khvatov ; [producer, Boris Mikhine ; script, Sergei Eisenstein, V. Pletniev, I. Kravtchunovsky, Grigori Alexandrov].
Cast: [Grigori Alexandrov, Maxim Strauch, Mikhail Gomarov], credited as Troupe of the workers Theatre.

results.title: Stabilizing soft sites
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how wet clay building sites can be cheaply and effectively stabilised by the addition of hydrated lime before building operations begin. This reduces expensive hold-ups due to bogged vehicles and the generally unpleasant conditions which prevail on a clay building site in winter.

results.title: St. Elmo's fire
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Lauren Shuler and Joel Schumacher
results.brief_description: This 80s Brat Pack film from Joel Schmacher depicts the ups and downs of life for a group of young college graduate friends who are looking for something beyond their diplomas. Leslie and Alex live together and argue over when to get married. Meanwhile, Kevin is secretly in love with Leslie as he passes his time writing obituaries for the newspaper. Wendy works for the welfare department and is in love with Billy, though her rich parents want her married and running the family franchise. Billy keeps living life like he just graduated, and is trying to stay faithful and sober enough to get back with his wife and baby. Jules experiences crisis after crisis as she spirals into debt, taking drugs, drinking and partying. Kirby is obsessed with an old flame. Cast includes: Rob Lowe, Demi Moore, Andrew McCarthy, Judd Nelson, Ally Sheedy, Emilio Estevez and Andie MacDowell.

results.title: St. Albans: an ethnic programme (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Canberra. College of Advanced Education. Media Centre and Ian Hart
results.brief_description: St Albans is a multilingual, multicultural community where 85% of the population are migrants from non-English speaking countries. St Albans East primary school, with a schools commission grant, employ parents in a program to increase the children’s awareness of community languages and culture.

results.title: St Paul's Cathedral
results.creator_credit: Merton Park and James E. Rogers
results.brief_description: A survey of London’s most famous cathedral, in itself a monument to Sir Christopher Wren. Its nave, central dome, whispering gallery, choir and high altar enshringe memorials to Nelson, Wellington, Gordon, Kitchener, and other famous men of the British Isles. Narrated by Robert Speaight,

results.title: St Kilda: the lonely islands
results.creator_credit: Films of Scotland and Christopher Mylne
results.brief_description: An evocation of the sense of timelessness which impresses itself on a visitor to this island in the Outer Hebrides. Depicts the unique fauna, and breathtaking beauty of the place, and shows the work of conservationists on the island.
